result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J. Writz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime work/fulltime school or a combination, and when not fully engaged must complete 10 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as recommended.
Court recommends for defendant to attend Outpatient Treatment and Health Care Center.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes:
SERVE 6 months and STAY 3 months for rule violations.
With huber for work, school, treatment, or a combination.
No objection to EMP.

PRELIMINARY HEARING IN 15CF1209:
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.

PLEA HEARING IN ALL CASES:
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
15CF825:
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>DRI.

15CF988:

Ct. 3 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.

15CF1209:

Ct. 5 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.

PLEA:

Ct. 2 (Possession of THC)>> NO CONTEST.

Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>> NO CONTEST.

15CF988:
Ct. 1 (Fraud on Taxicab Operator (<=2500))>> NO CONTEST.

Ct. 2 (Forgery)>> NO CONTEST.

15CM2281:
Ct. 1 (Issue of Worthless Checks (<=$2500))>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
15CF825:
Ct. 2 (Possession of THC)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, concurrent to all cases. CONDITIONS: Impose 9 Months MCJ w/Huber for work/school/treatment/or a combination, Serve 6 Months MCJ, Stay last 3 Months MCJ for rule violations, No objection to EMP, Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 10 Hours of Community Service per week, AODA and any follow up, Absolute Sobriety from drugs and alcohol, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 19 days Credit. Restitution in the amount of $650 to be paid- State to provide an Order for Restitution. 
COURT has strong recommendation for Defendant to attend Outpatient Treatment at Health Care Center.

15CF830:
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>  Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation, concurrent to all cases. No controlled substances without valid prescription and only in the amounts prescribed.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 with day reporting.    No contact with All American Taxi, Downtown Pawn, Wausau Gun & Loan, M.Z, Kwik Trip, Pawn America and Pick n Save.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
